text: guys does anybody have an idea how to integrate google now cards in the app instead of email markup..

do you have a contact at google?

classic google

<@U0K1ALDQE>: I recomend doing this, step by step:
Jenkins - It’s a PITA and you’ll learn a lot about CI just doing this
Circle/Travis - Much less of a pain, but you’ll get to learn how to write yaml configs and it’s basically jenkins made easy and you can try out doing automated deployment to google play using plugins or writing your own
??? (Maybe greenhouse, haven’t tried it yet but seems to be easier than those)
Buddybuild - Automagical with automatic deployment to select emails, groups, even google play, version upgrades

It might take you a while, but you’ll learn ins and outs of doing it
which one are you using <@U0548MM6B>
<@U053PPGDC> currently buddybuild, mostly because of the ease of deploying to certain groups, tho I still have Circle to deploy to beta because I didn’t set up buddybuild play deployment yet :smile:
right

also, they’re quite responsive, I’ve intercommed/tweeted them about a few things (like static analysis results being inaccessible and they asked me a lot of questions about it and added it to their feature list
what’s the pricing on buddybuild
all free for now
oh wow
they’ll keep the free tier when they decide on proper pricing

Any way to set up multiple flavors + tests and make them work in CI?
yup I do
i have actually 5 flavours
yep, just write in yaml which gradle tasks you want to run
I build 2 releases and 2 dogfood releases
Okay so in case you have 2 flavors, you produce 2 apks and your yaml describes what test to run on which apk?
I have a trigger in the commit message itself custom commit message to trigger different flavour build
So running all tests in AS will break test no matter what? when working with flavors
I dont have tests so not sure..
just define the commands under yaml like you’d do it in shell via gradle, like assembleFlavorOne connectedAndroidTest or something like that
I’m seeing some weird stuff :smile:
I have test, testFull and testDemo
When in debugFull and running testFull, test also runs
And it shouldn’t give any errors but we’ll ye it does :smile:
Only think I did was add demo/full flavor

we use command line to execute our instrumentation tests on Jenkins: `./gradlew -Pandroid.testInstrumentationRunnerArguments.class=hk.gogovan.GoGoVanClient2.test.NotificationTest createCnDevDebugCoverageReport || true`
I’m currently just working with unit tests
Only thing I did was provide 2 different strings when in demo / full flavor
Runs fine on device
Sorry guys!!
It was a bug in robolectric 3
as per usual
Does gradle have the same “clean” buggy stuff as AS?

tried in AS and it worked
ran `./gradlew clean test` and it worked. Ran `./gradlew test` again and it kept working
/gif annoyed
any idea about finishAffinity()?
something i saw in appCompat
to use to finish all activity with current one who have the same affinity
Finish this activity as well as all activities immediately below it in the current task that have the same affinity.
What about it?
I’ve used it before
will it really kill all activity if i call it
i have a use case where i  screen 1-> screen 2-> screen 3
intent.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK | IntentCompat.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TASK);
using this flags
so asking if that really works on all API level i can simply use that function ..
So you're asking whether setting the flags will be enough?
Or are you wondering whether you should still call finishActivity()?
just wondering which is ideal as both outcome the same result
what i want
never used finishAffinity() before
Well afaik finishActivity will get called no matter how the activity is finished.
Oh finishAffinity?
<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33497151/activity-finishaffinity-vs-intent-flag-activity-new-task-intent-flag-activit>

attachments.title: Activity.finishAffinity() vs Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK | Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TASK
attachments.text: In Android, if you want to clear your current Activity stack and launch a new Activity (for example, logging out of the app and launching a log in Activity), there appears to be two approaches. Are

text: there’s a very real overhead using XML layouts
> user avatar (using Fresco)
TRIGGER WARNING
hah
the results for the low-end device is particularly telling

> THL W8 4.2.2
> XML: 113 (min), 194 (max), 128.69 (avg)
> Code: 40 (min), 65 (max), 42.53 (avg)
(results in milliseconds, lower is better)
